Can you take all the characters you created and break them into two categories: 1) Necessary for the murder to be solved. 2) not necessary for the murder to be solved
Assistant
Certainly! Below is the breakdown of all characters into two categories: those necessary for the murder to be solved and those not necessary for the murder to be solved.

1) Necessary for the Murder to Be Solved

These characters are integral to the plot, either because of their direct involvement in the murder or because they hold essential clues or relationships that will guide others to uncover the truth.

Core Characters:

    1. Serafina Eldridge (The High Witch)
    - Role: The victim of the murder. Though she dies early, clues about her relationships and suspicions are vital for solving the mystery.
  1. Sable Blackthorn (The Ambitious Witch)
    - Role: The murderer. Sable’s ambition and use of forbidden magic make her the one who kills Serafina. Her role is essential to the mystery.
  1. Lilith Ravenspell (The Rival Witch)
    - Role: Serafina’s rival. Lilith’s longstanding conflict with Serafina provides key motives and red herrings for other players to follow.
  1. Fiona Moonshadow (The Healer Witch)
    - Role: A close confidant and secret lover of Serafina. Fiona’s emotions and hidden relationship with Serafina provide crucial clues for uncovering the truth.
  1. Rowena Nightshade (The Necromancer)
    - Role: As a necromancer, Rowena’s ability to communicate with spirits makes her key to revealing hidden truths about Serafina’s death.
  1. Balthazar Thorn (The Warlock)
    - Role: Serafina’s close confidant who holds critical knowledge of dark rituals. His cryptic hints and manipulation of the investigation play a pivotal role in solving the mystery.
  1. Mordred Grimshade (The Hexbreaker)
    - Role: His failure to prevent the curse that killed Serafina makes him a crucial figure in the investigation. His knowledge of hexes and dark magic is vital.
  1. Lucien Evernight (The Seer)
    - Role: A seer who claims to have foreseen Serafina’s death. His cryptic visions provide clues to guide others toward solving the mystery.
  1. Thorne Duskwraith (The Guardian)
    - Role: As Serafina’s protector, Thorne holds important knowledge about her recent fears and alliances. His role as guardian is crucial for uncovering motives.

2) Not Necessary for the Murder to Be Solved

These characters can enhance the story, provide additional red herrings, or serve to deepen the world of the coven, but their involvement isn’t essential to solving the murder. They are great for adding complexity or for expanding the guest list, but they don’t hold critical information that directly leads to identifying the murderer.

Non-Essential Characters:

    1. Gideon Blackthorn (The Loyal Cousin)
    - Role: Sable’s cousin. Though loyal, Gideon’s suspicions don’t directly affect the resolution of the murder.
  1. Draven Hawke (The Spirit Summoner)
    - Role: His summoning abilities provide intrigue, but his knowledge of the spirits isn’t critical to solving the murder.
  1. Cyrus Duskbane (The Forbidden Scholar)
    - Role: His study of forbidden magic adds tension but doesn’t directly contribute to uncovering the murderer.
  1. Ronan Blackwood (The Exiled)
    - Role: His past exile and recent return add drama to the story, but Ronan isn’t necessary for the investigation.
  1. Sebastian Nightfall (The Enchanter)
    - Role: Sebastian’s manipulative abilities provide red herrings, but his involvement doesn’t directly lead to the resolution of the murder.
  1. Isolde Frostveil (The Potion Mistress)
    - Role: Her potions provide potential clues, but she doesn’t hold any information that directly solves the murder.
  1. Vivienne Duskraven (The Enchantress)
    - Role: Vivienne’s seductive powers add tension and suspicion, but her role is more about creating red herrings than providing key clues.
  1. Selene Stormbringer (The Elemental Witch)
    - Role: Her elemental magic provides drama but isn’t key to solving the murder.
  1. Aradia Nightshade (The Oracle)
    - Role: Her visions are intriguing, but they don’t directly lead to the uncovering of the murderer.
  1. Elysian Shadowcloak (The Shapeshifter)
    - Role: Elysian’s shapeshifting abilities create mystery but don’t offer vital clues to solve the crime.
  1. Talon Nightshade (The Cursebreaker)
    - Role: Their role as a cursebreaker adds intrigue, but their involvement isn’t central to uncovering the truth about the murder.
  1. Astra Moonveil (The Illusionist)
    - Role: Astra’s illusions provide additional layers of mystery, but they don’t directly affect the investigation’s outcome.
  1. Valen Thornbriar (The Summoner)
    - Role: Their summoning abilities add to the magical atmosphere but don’t contribute directly to solving the murder.
  1. Lorian Silvermist (The Alchemist)
    - Role: Their potions and transmutations provide potential clues but aren’t essential to solving the mystery.
  1. Ember Nightshade (The Firebrand)
    - Role: Their control over fire magic adds to the drama but doesn’t lead directly to the murderer.
  1. Solace Duskweaver (The Dreamweaver)
    - Role: Solace’s dreamweaving abilities add depth to the story, but they don’t provide the crucial information needed to solve the mystery.

Summary

  • Necessary Characters (9 total): These characters hold key clues, relationships, or roles essential for unraveling the murder mystery.
  • Non-Essential Characters (15 total): While these characters enhance the story, provide red herrings, and add depth to the world, they aren’t required for solving the murder.
Would you like to make any changes or enhancements based on this breakdown? For example, we could adjust the roles of non-essential characters to give them a bigger part in the mystery, or we could fine-tune any existing relationships to better fit your event size. Let me know how you'd like to proceed!

User
in the same categories as above, provide a description of how each character could look and costume suggestions
Assistant
Below are detailed costume descriptions for each character, broken down into the two categories: necessary for the murder to be solved and not necessary for the murder to be solved. I’ve provided ideas for both appearance and clothing that align with each character’s personality and role in the murder mystery.

1) Necessary for the Murder to Be Solved

Female Characters

1. Serafina Eldridge (The High Witch)

    - Look: Regal, commanding, and powerful. Serafina should appear as the leader of the coven, with a grand, authoritative presence.
  • Costume: A flowing, dark robe with intricate gold or silver symbols representing power and leadership. A tall, elaborate headdress or crown symbolizing her status. Adorned with ornate jewelry like a large amulet or staff. The color palette could include black, deep purple, or royal blue, accented with metallics.

2. Sable Blackthorn (The Ambitious Witch)

    - Look: Dark and mysterious with a hint of danger. Sable’s ambition should come across through her appearance.
  • Costume: A sleek, fitted robe or gown in deep red or black, signifying her power-hungry nature. She might wear a belt with small magical tools (vials, herbs, or small pouches) around her waist. Her makeup could be dark and bold, with sharp features and a confident posture.

3. Lilith Ravenspell (The Rival Witch)

    - Look: Slightly older and refined, Lilith’s appearance should reflect her experience and rivalry with Serafina.
  • Costume: A flowing gown or robe in deep green or silver, symbolizing her connection to nature and her ambition. A dark cloak and staff could further enhance her witchy aesthetic. She might wear a witch's hat or a decorative headpiece adorned with silver and green gems.

4. Fiona Moonshadow (The Healer Witch)

    - Look: Gentle and ethereal. Fiona’s appearance should reflect her healer’s role, with soft and calming energy.
  • Costume: A soft, flowing gown in earthy tones like light green, soft lavender, or white. She could wear a herbalist’s belt with small potion bottles and healing herbs. A simple headband or floral wreath around her hair, with natural, minimalistic makeup.

5. Rowena Nightshade (The Necromancer)

    - Look: Dark and ominous, with a slightly gothic appearance. Rowena’s necromantic powers should be reflected in her attire.
  • Costume: A black or dark purple robe with skull or bone motifs. She could carry a small skull or bone staff, and her accessories might include gothic rings or a pendant in the shape of a raven. Her makeup should be pale with dark, hollowed eyes, emphasizing her connection to death and the spirit world.

Male Characters

1. Balthazar Thorn (The Warlock)

    - Look: Powerful and secretive. Balthazar’s appearance should be mysterious, with an air of authority.
  • Costume: A deep black or dark purple cloak with intricate magical symbols embroidered into the fabric. He could wear a hood that obscures part of his face or a mask. His accessories might include a staff or a crystal amulet, with rings on his fingers. He should have an enigmatic, almost intimidating presence.

2. Mordred Grimshade (The Hexbreaker)

    - Look: Tough and battle-worn, Mordred’s appearance should reflect his role as the coven’s protector against dark magic.
  • Costume: A black, weathered leather cloak or vest over a simple, functional robe. He might carry a small dagger or protective charm. His accessories could include a belt with spell-breaking tools, and his makeup might include runes or symbols drawn on his hands or face.

3. Lucien Evernight (The Seer)

    - Look: Eerie and prophetic. Lucien’s appearance should reflect his seer abilities, with an otherworldly quality.
  • Costume: A robe in soft, flowing fabrics like silver, gray, or white, with subtle star or moon patterns to reflect his ability to see the future. He could wear a blindfold or a veil over his eyes, with a crystal ball or divination tools as props. His makeup could include silver or white accents to make him appear ethereal.

4. Thorne Duskwraith (The Guardian)

    - Look: Strong and protective, Thorne’s appearance should reflect his role as a guardian.
  • Costume: A long black cloak or leather armor-style outfit, practical for someone who must protect others. He could carry a sword or a shield with magical symbols etched into it. His makeup could be minimal, with a stern, weathered look that shows his years of service as a protector.

2) Not Necessary for the Murder to Be Solved

Female Characters

1. Isolde Frostveil (The Potion Mistress)

    - Look: Reserved and methodical. Isolde’s look should reflect her knowledge of alchemy and potion-making.
  • Costume: A robe in earthy colors, like green, brown, or dark blue, with a belt full of small vials, herbs, and potions. Her accessories might include an apron and gloves, and her makeup should be simple, with a focused, analytical look.

2. Vivienne Duskraven (The Enchantress)

    - Look: Seductive and enchanting. Vivienne’s appearance should exude charm and mystery.
  • Costume: A sleek, form-fitting gown in deep red or black, with a low-cut neckline or flowing sleeves. She could wear a crystal necklace or charm and carry a small mirror or enchanting tool. Her makeup should be bold and alluring, with dark eyeliner and red lips.

3. Selene Stormbringer (The Elemental Witch)

    - Look: Elemental and powerful. Selene’s appearance should reflect her connection to nature and the elements.
  • Costume: A flowing robe or gown in blue, green, or white, representing water, wind, and earth. She could wear jewelry made of stones, shells, or crystals, and carry a staff or talisman related to the elements. Her makeup could be ethereal, with flowing waves or lightning bolt designs.

4. Aradia Nightshade (The Oracle)

    - Look: Mystical and dreamlike. Aradia’s appearance should reflect her oracle powers.
  • Costume: A long, flowing robe in soft colors like lavender, silver, or white, with star or moon symbols. She could wear a crown or circlet and carry a crystal ball or tarot cards. Her makeup should include light, shimmering tones to make her look ethereal and prophetic.

Male Characters

1. Gideon Blackthorn (The Loyal Cousin)

    - Look: Protective and determined. Gideon’s appearance should reflect his loyalty and determination to protect his cousin, Sable.
  • Costume: A simple, practical robe in dark gray or brown, with a leather belt or vest. He could wear a cloak and carry a small dagger or protection charm. His look should be clean and straightforward, with minimal makeup.

2. Draven Hawke (The Spirit Summoner)

    - Look: Reclusive and haunted. Draven’s appearance should reflect his connection to the spirit world.
  • Costume: A dark, tattered robe with symbols of spirits and death. He could carry a small skull or bone and wear a hood that obscures part of his face. His makeup could be pale, with dark circles under his eyes, showing his frequent interaction with spirits.

3. Cyrus Duskbane (The Forbidden Scholar)

    - Look: Mysterious and scholarly. Cyrus’s appearance should reflect his thirst for forbidden knowledge.
  • Costume: A dark cloak with a leather-bound book or scrolls. He could wear glasses and carry a quill or ink bottle. His makeup should be minimal, but he could have a studious and calculating expression.

4. Ronan Blackwood (The Exiled)

    - Look: Rogue-like and dangerous. Ronan’s appearance should reflect his past exile and dangerous magic.
  • Costume: A dark, tattered cloak with a hood, carrying a staff or dagger. He could have chains or cuffs as accessories, hinting at his past exile. His makeup could include scars or rough, weathered features.

5. Sebastian Nightfall (The Enchanter)

    - Look: Charming and manipulative. Sebastian’s appearance should reflect his enchanting abilities.
  • Costume: A sleek, tailored robe or suit in dark colors like black or midnight blue. He could wear rings, a charm necklace, or other accessories that reflect his enchanting abilities. His makeup should be sharp and charismatic, with a confident posture.

Gender-Neutral Characters

1. Elysian Shadowcloak (The Shapeshifter)

    - Look: Ever-changing and mysterious. Elysian’s appearance should reflect their shapeshifting ability.
  • Costume: A layered, multi-colored robe that appears to shift and change colors in different lights. They could wear a mask or veil, obscuring their true identity. Their makeup could be fluid and abstract, with painted designs that reflect their ever-changing nature.

2. Talon Nightshade (The Cursebreaker)

    - Look: Dark and focused. Talon’s appearance should reflect their curse-breaking abilities.
  • Costume: A dark robe with protective symbols or runes embroidered on it. They could carry a small charm or dagger used in curse-breaking. Their makeup should be minimal, but
Assistant
they could have a serious and intense expression.

3. Astra Moonveil (The Illusionist)

    - Look: Mysterious and otherworldly. Astra’s appearance should reflect their illusion-creating powers.
  • Costume: A flowing robe in shimmering or iridescent colors, with patterns that appear to shift or move. They could carry a small mirror or orb used in creating illusions. Their makeup could include glitter or shimmering powder, with designs that give them a dreamlike quality.

4. Valen Thornbriar (The Summoner)

    - Look: Elemental and arcane. Valen’s appearance should reflect their connection to otherworldly beings.
  • Costume: A long, dark robe with runes and symbols related to summoning. They could carry a summoning staff or an amulet. Their makeup could include runic designs on their hands or face, symbolizing their connection to the creatures they summon.

5. Lorian Silvermist (The Alchemist)

    - Look: Practical and meticulous. Lorian’s appearance should reflect their work as an alchemist.
  • Costume: A practical robe or apron with pockets filled with small vials, herbs, and tools. They could carry a book or scroll with alchemical symbols. Their makeup should be minimal, but they could have a focused and scientific demeanor.

6. Ember Nightshade (The Firebrand)

    - Look: Fiery and passionate. Ember’s appearance should reflect their connection to fire magic.
  • Costume: A flowing red or orange robe with flame-like patterns. They could carry a torch or small flame symbol. Their makeup could include red and orange hues, with flame designs on their face or hands.

7. Solace Duskweaver (The Dreamweaver)

    - Look: Dreamlike and mystical. Solace’s appearance should reflect their dream-weaving abilities.
  • Costume: A soft, flowing robe in light colors like lavender, silver, or white, with star or moon symbols. They could carry a dreamcatcher or small orb. Their makeup could include shimmering powder or light designs that give them an ethereal, dreamlike quality.
This breakdown should give each guest a clear idea of how their character can dress, bringing more immersion and creativity into your murder mystery event. If you’d like help with anything else, feel free to let me know!
User
Can you provide A code to put in jotform for a theme layout for when people go to pick their character
Assistant
To create a character selection form with a themed layout in Jotform that reflects the atmosphere of The Hexed Circle: Coven Murder Mystery, you can customize the design using CSS to achieve a mystical, witchy look. Below is the code and steps on how to integrate it into Jotform for a character selection form.

Steps to Create a Themed Layout in Jotform:

  1. Create a New Form:
    - Log into your Jotform account.
  • Create a new form from scratch or choose a template, then add a Multiple Choice field (or Single Choice if each character can only be selected once) for character selection.
  1. Input Character Options:
    - Add the character names as options for the field where guests can select their preferred role.
  1. Add Custom CSS:
    - Navigate to Form Designer (paint roller icon on the right side of the Jotform builder).
  • Scroll down to the CSS section.
  • Copy and paste the CSS code provided below to style the form.

Sample CSS Code for a Mystical-Themed Character Selection Form:

css
/ Background: Dark mystical theme with a subtle pattern /
.form-all {
    background: url('https://www.linktoyourimage.com/mystical-background.jpg'); / Replace with your own background image link /
    background-size: cover;
    background-attachment: fixed;
    color: white;
    font-family: 'Garamond', serif;
}

/ Form title customization /
.form-header-group {
    text-align: center;
    color: #f7d0d0; / Light red for a magical tone /
    font-size: 28px;
    text-shadow: 2px 2px 4px #000;
}

/ Customize the field label (character selection prompt) /
.form-label {
    font-size: 18px;
    font-weight: bold;
    color: #f4f4f4;
}

/ Customize the radio/checkbox options /
.form-radio-item label, .form-checkbox-item label {
    font-size: 16px;
    padding: 5px;
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);
    border-radius: 5px;
    color: #f4e4c4; / Pale gold for text color /
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px #000;
}

/ Hover effect on options /
.form-radio-item:hover, .form-checkbox-item:hover {
    background-color: rgba(200, 200, 200, 0.1);
    color: #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Customize form button (Submit) /
.form-submit-button {
    background-color: #6b2a2a; / Deep red /
    color: white;
    font-size: 18px;
    padding: 10px 20px;
    border-radius: 8px;
    border: 2px solid #3e1515; / Dark red border /
    cursor: pointer;
}

.form-submit-button:hover {
    background-color: #902b2b;
    border-color: #6b2a2a;
}

/ Style the overall form /
.form-all {
    border: 2px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.5);
    box-shadow: 0px 0px 10px 4px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
    padding: 20px;
    border-radius: 10px;
}

/ Style character list container /
.form-line {
    margin-bottom: 15px;
}

/ Customize placeholder text for mystical appearance /
input::placeholder {
    color: #b8b8b8;
    font-style: italic;
}

/ Customize text area fields /
textarea {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
    color: white;
    border: 1px solid #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Make text fields dark and mysterious /
input {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
    color: white;
    border: 1px solid #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Make headings stand out /
.form-section {
    margin-bottom: 30px;
}

/ Add a mystical glow around the form /
.form-all {
    box-shadow: 0 0 15px 5px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
}

/ Make radio buttons larger /
input[type="radio"], input[type="checkbox"] {
    width: 18px;
    height: 18px;
}

/ Center the form on the page /
.supernova {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: center;
    align-items: center;
    min-height: 100vh;
}

Key Elements in the Code:

    - Background: Replace the link in the background: url(''); with a URL to a mystical background image (like stars, enchanted forests, or arcane symbols) to fit your theme. You can find free images from websites like Unsplash or Pexels.
  • Form Title: Customizes the title of your form with a light red color and text shadow for a magical feel.
  • Options (Characters): Each character option is styled with a glowing background and hover effect to make the form more engaging and interactive.
  • Submit Button: Styled to look like an enchanted button with deep red tones and a subtle hover effect.

Next Steps:

  1. Replace Background Image: Replace the image URL in the background: url(''); section with the URL of your chosen background.
  2. Customize Colors: You can adjust the colors to match your coven theme more closely. For example, change the button color, text color, or hover effects to fit your design vision.
  3. Test the Form: Once the form is styled, test it on different devices to ensure the layout works well on mobile and desktop.
This CSS provides a magical, immersive experience for when your guests select their characters. If you need further customization or have any specific requests (like adding specific character names or more advanced features), feel free to let me know!
User
Can you provide a url
Assistant
Unfortunately, I cannot provide or host images directly. However, I can guide you on how to find a suitable mystical background image for your Jotform and generate a URL for it.

Steps to Get an Image URL for Jotform:

  1. Find an Image:
    - Go to a free stock photo website like:
  • Unsplash
  • Pexels
  • Pixabay
  • Search for terms like "mystical background," "magic forest," "enchanted sky," or "arcane symbols."
  1. Get the Image URL:
    - Once you’ve found an image, click on it to open it fully.
  • Right-click on the image and select "Copy Image Address" or "Copy Image URL" (the exact phrasing will depend on your browser).
  • This URL is what you’ll use in the CSS code for Jotform.
  1. Insert the URL into Your CSS Code:
    - Replace the background: url(''); line in the CSS with the image URL you just copied. It should look like this:
css
     background: url('https://www.example.com/path/to/mystical-image.jpg');
  1. Test the Form:
    - Go back to your Jotform and see how the background looks. You can adjust the image’s size and positioning with the background-size and background-position properties in the CSS.
Here’s an example of what your code might look like after inserting a URL for a mystical background: 
css
.form-all {
    background: url('https://www.pexels.com/photo/mystical-forest-forest-path-1869807/') no-repeat center center;
    background-size: cover;
    background-attachment: fixed;
    color: white;
    font-family: 'Garamond', serif;
}

Alternative Method:

If you’d like, you can also upload an image to any image hosting service (like Imgur or Google Drive) and use the URL from there. Once you have the image, you can easily integrate it into your Jotform design using the provided CSS. Let me know if you need further assistance with any part of the process!
User
Will this link work: Photo by Suzy Hazelwood from Pexels: https://www.pexels.com/photo/blue-and-red-galaxy-artwork-1629236/
Assistant
The link you provided points to a page, not directly to the image itself, so it won’t work as-is in the CSS for your Jotform background. To use this image, you need the direct URL of the image file. Here’s how you can get it:

Steps to Get the Direct Image URL from Pexels:

  1. Open the Image:
    - Go to the page of the image: Pexels - Blue and Red Galaxy Artwork.
  1. Right-Click on the Image:
    - Right-click directly on the image displayed.
  • Choose "Open image in new tab" (or "Copy Image Address" directly if available in your browser).
  1. Copy the URL:
    - Once the image opens in a new tab, copy the URL from the address bar. It should look something like this:
     https://images.pexels.com/photos/1629236/pexels-photo-1629236.jpeg
  1. Use this URL in Your CSS Code:
    - Now, you can replace the image URL in your Jotform CSS like so:
css
.form-all {
    background: url('https://images.pexels.com/photos/1629236/pexels-photo-1629236.jpeg') no-repeat center center;
    background-size: cover;
    background-attachment: fixed;
    color: white;
    font-family: 'Garamond', serif;
}
This will set the blue and red galaxy artwork as the background for your Jotform. Let me know if you encounter any issues!
User
Will this https://images.pexels.com/photos/1629236/pexels-photo-1629236.jpeg?auto=compress&cs=tinysrgb&w=1260&h=750&dpr=2
Assistant
Yes, the direct link you provided will work perfectly as a background image for your Jotform! Here's how you can integrate it into your CSS:

CSS with Your Image URL:

css
.form-all {
    background: url('https://images.pexels.com/photos/1629236/pexels-photo-1629236.jpeg?auto=compress&cs=tinysrgb&w=1260&h=750&dpr=2') no-repeat center center;
    background-size: cover;
    background-attachment: fixed;
    color: white;
    font-family: 'Garamond', serif;
}
This will set the blue and red galaxy artwork as the background for your form, creating the magical, mystical theme you’re looking for.

Final Steps:

  • Add CSS: Insert this CSS into the Form Designer > CSS section of your Jotform.
  • Test the Look: Preview the form to ensure it looks exactly how you want. Adjust background-size or other properties as needed.
Let me know if you need any further tweaks or help with additional customizations!
User
Awesome. Will you redo the whole code you gave earlier with this link inserted
Assistant
Certainly! Here's the full CSS code I provided earlier, updated with the galaxy background image link you provided. This code will apply the theme to your Jotform with a mystical, enchanting atmosphere:

Complete CSS for Mystical-Themed Jotform:

css
/ Background: Mystical theme with the galaxy artwork /
.form-all {
    background: url('https://images.pexels.com/photos/1629236/pexels-photo-1629236.jpeg?auto=compress&cs=tinysrgb&w=1260&h=750&dpr=2') no-repeat center center;
    background-size: cover;
    background-attachment: fixed;
    color: white;
    font-family: 'Garamond', serif;
}

/ Form title customization /
.form-header-group {
    text-align: center;
    color: #f7d0d0; / Light red for a magical tone /
    font-size: 28px;
    text-shadow: 2px 2px 4px #000;
}

/ Customize the field label (character selection prompt) /
.form-label {
    font-size: 18px;
    font-weight: bold;
    color: #f4f4f4;
}

/ Customize the radio/checkbox options /
.form-radio-item label, .form-checkbox-item label {
    font-size: 16px;
    padding: 5px;
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);
    border-radius: 5px;
    color: #f4e4c4; / Pale gold for text color /
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px #000;
}

/ Hover effect on options /
.form-radio-item:hover, .form-checkbox-item:hover {
    background-color: rgba(200, 200, 200, 0.1);
    color: #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Customize form button (Submit) /
.form-submit-button {
    background-color: #6b2a2a; / Deep red /
    color: white;
    font-size: 18px;
    padding: 10px 20px;
    border-radius: 8px;
    border: 2px solid #3e1515; / Dark red border /
    cursor: pointer;
}

.form-submit-button:hover {
    background-color: #902b2b;
    border-color: #6b2a2a;
}

/ Style the overall form /
.form-all {
    border: 2px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.5);
    box-shadow: 0px 0px 10px 4px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
    padding: 20px;
    border-radius: 10px;
}

/ Style character list container /
.form-line {
    margin-bottom: 15px;
}

/ Customize placeholder text for mystical appearance /
input::placeholder {
    color: #b8b8b8;
    font-style: italic;
}

/ Customize text area fields /
textarea {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
    color: white;
    border: 1px solid #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Make text fields dark and mysterious /
input {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
    color: white;
    border: 1px solid #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Make headings stand out /
.form-section {
    margin-bottom: 30px;
}

/ Add a mystical glow around the form /
.form-all {
    box-shadow: 0 0 15px 5px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
}

/ Make radio buttons larger /
input[type="radio"], input[type="checkbox"] {
    width: 18px;
    height: 18px;
}

/ Center the form on the page /
.supernova {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: center;
    align-items: center;
    min-height: 100vh;
}

Instructions to Apply the Code:

    1. Log into Jotform and open the form you’re working on.
  1. Navigate to Form Designer (the paint roller icon).
  2. Scroll down to the CSS section.
  3. Paste the entire code above into the CSS area.
  4. Save your form and preview it to ensure the layout looks as intended.
This will give your form a mystical galaxy background, with custom fonts, styled buttons, and interactive elements like the radio buttons for character selection, creating an immersive experience for your guests. If you need more adjustments, feel free to ask!
User
/ Background: Mystical theme with the galaxy artwork / .form-all { background: url('https://images.pexels.com/photos/1629236/pexels-photo-1629236.jpeg?auto=compress&cs=tinysrgb&w=1260&h=750&dpr=2') no-repeat center center; background-size: cover; background-attachment: fixed; color: white; font-family: 'Garamond', serif; } / Form title customization / .form-header-group { text-align: center; color: #f7d0d0; / Light red for a magical tone / font-size: 28px; text-shadow: 2px 2px 4px #000; } / Customize the field label (character selection prompt) / .form-label { font-size: 18px; font-weight: bold; color: #f4f4f4; } / Customize the radio/checkbox options / .form-radio-item label, .form-checkbox-item label { font-size: 16px; padding: 5px; background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6); border-radius: 5px; color: #f4e4c4; / Pale gold for text color / text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px #000; } / Hover effect on options / .form-radio-item:hover, .form-checkbox-item:hover { background-color: rgba(200, 200, 200, 0.1); color: #fff; border-radius: 5px; } / Customize form button (Submit) / .form-submit-button { background-color: #6b2a2a; / Deep red / color: white; Is this the whole code? font-size: 18px; padding: 10px 20px; border-radius: 8px; border: 2px solid #3e1515; / Dark red border / cursor: pointer; } .form-submit-button:hover { background-color: #902b2b; border-color: #6b2a2a; } / Style the overall form / .form-all { border: 2px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.5); box-shadow: 0px 0px 10px 4px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2); padding: 20px; border-radius: 10px; } / Style character list container / .form-line { margin-bottom: 15px; } / Customize placeholder text for mystical appearance / input::placeholder { color: #b8b8b8; font-style: italic; } / Customize text area fields / textarea { background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4); color: white; border: 1px solid #fff; border-radius: 5px; } / Make text fields dark and mysterious / input { background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4); color: white; border: 1px solid #fff; border-radius: 5px; } / Make headings stand out / .form-section { margin-bottom: 30px; } / Add a mystical glow around the form / .form-all { box-shadow: 0 0 15px 5px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2); } / Make radio buttons larger / input[type="radio"], input[type="checkbox"] { width: 18px; height: 18px; } / Center the form on the page / .supernova { display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; min-height: 100vh; }
Assistant
Yes, the code you posted is the complete CSS for customizing your Jotform with the galaxy background and themed design elements. Here's a quick overview of what each section does:
  1. Background and Font:
    - Applies the galaxy background image to your form and uses the Garamond font to give it an elegant, mystical style.
  1. Form Title:
    - Customizes the form header with light red text and a shadow effect to give it a magical appearance.
  1. Form Labels:
    - Adjusts the appearance of field labels, making them bold and fitting the color theme.
  1. Radio/Checkbox Options:
    - Styles the character selection options (radio or checkbox fields), with a golden text color and a hover effect that enhances interactivity.
  1. Submit Button:
    - Customizes the submit button with deep red colors and a hover effect.
  1. Form Borders and Shadow:
    - Adds borders, padding, and a mystical glow effect around the form.
  1. Input and Text Areas:
    - Styles the input fields with a dark, magical look, ensuring text fields match the form's theme.
  1. Radio and Checkbox Buttons:
    - Enlarges the radio and checkbox buttons to improve usability and match the mystical theme.
  1. Centering the Form:
    - Ensures the form is centered on the page, providing a clean and professional appearance.

How to Use the CSS:

    1. Copy the Full CSS Code:
Copy the entire CSS code you’ve posted above.
  1. Apply it in Jotform:
    - Go to your Jotform.
  • Open Form Designer (the paint roller icon).
  • Scroll down to the CSS tab and paste the code.
  • Save and preview your form to see the changes.
Let me know if you need any additional tweaks or adjustments!
User
Can you redo the code with this link? https://plus.unsplash.com/premium_photo-1724686850464-7a289d7b570d?q=80&w=2832&auto=format&fit=crop&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&ixid=M3wxMjA3fDB8MHxwaG90by1wYWdlfHx8fGVufDB8fHx8fA%3D%3D
Assistant
Absolutely! Here's the updated CSS code with the new background image URL you provided:

Updated Jotform CSS with New Background Image

css
/ Background: Mystical theme with the new galaxy artwork /
.form-all {
    background: url('https://plus.unsplash.com/premium_photo-1724686850464-7a289d7b570d?q=80&w=2832&auto=format&fit=crop&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&ixid=M3wxMjA3fDB8MHxwaG90by1wYWdlfHx8fGVufDB8fHx8fA%3D%3D') no-repeat center center;
    background-size: cover;
    background-attachment: fixed;
    color: white;
    font-family: 'Garamond', serif;
}

/ Form title customization /
.form-header-group {
    text-align: center;
    color: #f7d0d0; / Light red for a magical tone /
    font-size: 28px;
    text-shadow: 2px 2px 4px #000;
}

/ Customize the field label (character selection prompt) /
.form-label {
    font-size: 18px;
    font-weight: bold;
    color: #f4f4f4;
}

/ Customize the radio/checkbox options /
.form-radio-item label, .form-checkbox-item label {
    font-size: 16px;
    padding: 5px;
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);
    border-radius: 5px;
    color: #f4e4c4; / Pale gold for text color /
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px #000;
}

/ Hover effect on options /
.form-radio-item:hover, .form-checkbox-item:hover {
    background-color: rgba(200, 200, 200, 0.1);
    color: #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Customize form button (Submit) /
.form-submit-button {
    background-color: #6b2a2a; / Deep red /
    color: white;
    font-size: 18px;
    padding: 10px 20px;
    border-radius: 8px;
    border: 2px solid #3e1515; / Dark red border /
    cursor: pointer;
}

.form-submit-button:hover {
    background-color: #902b2b;
    border-color: #6b2a2a;
}

/ Style the overall form /
.form-all {
    border: 2px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.5);
    box-shadow: 0px 0px 10px 4px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
    padding: 20px;
    border-radius: 10px;
}

/ Style character list container /
.form-line {
    margin-bottom: 15px;
}

/ Customize placeholder text for mystical appearance /
input::placeholder {
    color: #b8b8b8;
    font-style: italic;
}

/ Customize text area fields /
textarea {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
    color: white;
    border: 1px solid #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Make text fields dark and mysterious /
input {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
    color: white;
    border: 1px solid #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Make headings stand out /
.form-section {
    margin-bottom: 30px;
}

/ Add a mystical glow around the form /
.form-all {
    box-shadow: 0 0 15px 5px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
}

/ Make radio buttons larger /
input[type="radio"], input[type="checkbox"] {
    width: 18px;
    height: 18px;
}

/ Center the form on the page /
.supernova {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: center;
    align-items: center;
    min-height: 100vh;
}

Instructions to Apply the Code:

    1. Log into Jotform and open your form.
  1. Navigate to Form Designer (the paint roller icon).
  2. Scroll down to the CSS tab.
  3. Paste the updated code into the CSS section.
  4. Save and preview your form to see the new background and design.
This will apply the new galaxy-themed background and maintain all the styled elements from before. Let me know if you need further adjustments or customizations!

Assistant
Sure! Here’s the updated CSS code with the new background image you provided:

Updated Jotform CSS with New Background Image

css
/ Background: Mystical theme with the new background /
.form-all {
    background: url('https://images.pexels.com/photos/3607083/pexels-photo-3607083.jpeg?auto=compress&cs=tinysrgb&w=1260&h=750&dpr=2') no-repeat center center;
    background-size: cover;
    background-attachment: fixed;
    color: white;
    font-family: 'Garamond', serif;
}

/ Form title customization /
.form-header-group {
    text-align: center;
    color: #f7d0d0; / Light red for a magical tone /
    font-size: 28px;
    text-shadow: 2px 2px 4px #000;
}

/ Customize the field label (character selection prompt) /
.form-label {
    font-size: 18px;
    font-weight: bold;
    color: #f4f4f4;
}

/ Customize the radio/checkbox options /
.form-radio-item label, .form-checkbox-item label {
    font-size: 16px;
    padding: 5px;
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);
    border-radius: 5px;
    color: #f4e4c4; / Pale gold for text color /
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px #000;
}

/ Hover effect on options /
.form-radio-item:hover, .form-checkbox-item:hover {
    background-color: rgba(200, 200, 200, 0.1);
    color: #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Customize form button (Submit) /
.form-submit-button {
    background-color: #6b2a2a; / Deep red /
    color: white;
    font-size: 18px;
    padding: 10px 20px;
    border-radius: 8px;
    border: 2px solid #3e1515; / Dark red border /
    cursor: pointer;
}

.form-submit-button:hover {
    background-color: #902b2b;
    border-color: #6b2a2a;
}

/ Style the overall form /
.form-all {
    border: 2px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.5);
    box-shadow: 0px 0px 10px 4px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
    padding: 20px;
    border-radius: 10px;
}

/ Style character list container /
.form-line {
    margin-bottom: 15px;
}

/ Customize placeholder text for mystical appearance /
input::placeholder {
    color: #b8b8b8;
    font-style: italic;
}

/ Customize text area fields /
textarea {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
    color: white;
    border: 1px solid #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Make text fields dark and mysterious /
input {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
    color: white;
    border: 1px solid #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Make headings stand out /
.form-section {
    margin-bottom: 30px;
}

/ Add a mystical glow around the form /
.form-all {
    box-shadow: 0 0 15px 5px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
}

/ Make radio buttons larger /
input[type="radio"], input[type="checkbox"] {
    width: 18px;
    height: 18px;
}

/ Center the form on the page /
.supernova {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: center;
    align-items: center;
    min-height: 100vh;
}

How to Use the CSS:

    1. Log into Jotform and open the form you're working on.
  1. Click on Form Designer (the paint roller icon).
  2. Scroll to the CSS section and paste the full CSS code.
  3. Save your form and preview it to ensure everything looks as expected with the new background.
This will apply the new image you provided as the form’s background while maintaining the rest of the custom styles, like the button, text, and layout effects. Feel free to test it out, and let me know if you need any further adjustments!

Do it with this https://images.pexels.com/photos/3488402/pexels-photo-3488402.jpeg
Assistant
Here's the updated Jotform CSS code with the new background image link you provided:

Updated Jotform CSS with New Background Image

css
/ Background: Mystical theme with the new background /
.form-all {
    background: url('https://images.pexels.com/photos/3488402/pexels-photo-3488402.jpeg') no-repeat center center;
    background-size: cover;
    background-attachment: fixed;
    color: white;
    font-family: 'Garamond', serif;
}

/ Form title customization /
.form-header-group {
    text-align: center;
    color: #f7d0d0; / Light red for a magical tone /
    font-size: 28px;
    text-shadow: 2px 2px 4px #000;
}

/ Customize the field label (character selection prompt) /
.form-label {
    font-size: 18px;
    font-weight: bold;
    color: #f4f4f4;
}

/ Customize the radio/checkbox options /
.form-radio-item label, .form-checkbox-item label {
    font-size: 16px;
    padding: 5px;
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);
    border-radius: 5px;
    color: #f4e4c4; / Pale gold for text color /
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px #000;
}

/ Hover effect on options /
.form-radio-item:hover, .form-checkbox-item:hover {
    background-color: rgba(200, 200, 200, 0.1);
    color: #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Customize form button (Submit) /
.form-submit-button {
    background-color: #6b2a2a; / Deep red /
    color: white;
    font-size: 18px;
    padding: 10px 20px;
    border-radius: 8px;
    border: 2px solid #3e1515; / Dark red border /
    cursor: pointer;
}

.form-submit-button:hover {
    background-color: #902b2b;
    border-color: #6b2a2a;
}

/ Style the overall form /
.form-all {
    border: 2px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.5);
    box-shadow: 0px 0px 10px 4px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
    padding: 20px;
    border-radius: 10px;
}

/ Style character list container /
.form-line {
    margin-bottom: 15px;
}

/ Customize placeholder text for mystical appearance /
input::placeholder {
    color: #b8b8b8;
    font-style: italic;
}

/ Customize text area fields /
textarea {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
    color: white;
    border: 1px solid #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Make text fields dark and mysterious /
input {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
    color: white;
    border: 1px solid #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Make headings stand out /
.form-section {
    margin-bottom: 30px;
}

/ Add a mystical glow around the form /
.form-all {
    box-shadow: 0 0 15px 5px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
}

/ Make radio buttons larger /
input[type="radio"], input[type="checkbox"] {
    width: 18px;
    height: 18px;
}

/ Center the form on the page /
.supernova {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: center;
    align-items: center;
    min-height: 100vh;
}

Instructions:

    1. Log into Jotform and open your form.
  1. Click on Form Designer (the paint roller icon).
  2. Scroll down to the CSS section and paste the updated CSS code.
  3. Save and preview your form to check the new background.
The background image you provided will now be set for the form, along with all the styling effects to create a mystical, immersive atmosphere. Let me know if you need any more tweaks!
User
Can you provide the code again but make the font black and bold? It is showing up white
Assistant
Certainly! Below is the updated CSS code with the font color changed to black and all text made bold for better visibility against the background:

Updated Jotform CSS with Black, Bold Font

css
/ Background: Mystical theme with the new background /
.form-all {
    background: url('https://images.pexels.com/photos/3488402/pexels-photo-3488402.jpeg') no-repeat center center;
    background-size: cover;
    background-attachment: fixed;
    color: black;  / Change text color to black /
    font-family: 'Garamond', serif;
    font-weight: bold;  / Make all text bold /
}

/ Form title customization /
.form-header-group {
    text-align: center;
    color: black; / Change title text color to black /
    font-size: 28px;
    text-shadow: none; / Remove text shadow for clarity /
    font-weight: bold;
}

/ Customize the field label (character selection prompt) /
.form-label {
    font-size: 18px;
    font-weight: bold;
    color: black; / Change label text color to black /
}

/ Customize the radio/checkbox options /
.form-radio-item label, .form-checkbox-item label {
    font-size: 16px;
    padding: 5px;
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);  / Lighten background of options /
    border-radius: 5px;
    color: black;  / Change option text color to black /
    font-weight: bold;
}

/ Hover effect on options /
.form-radio-item:hover, .form-checkbox-item:hover {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);  / Darken hover effect /
    color: black;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Customize form button (Submit) /
.form-submit-button {
    background-color: #6b2a2a; / Deep red /
    color: white;
    font-size: 18px;
    padding: 10px 20px;
    border-radius: 8px;
    border: 2px solid #3e1515; / Dark red border /
    cursor: pointer;
}

.form-submit-button:hover {
    background-color: #902b2b;
    border-color: #6b2a2a;
}

/ Style the overall form /
.form-all {
    border: 2px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.5);
    box-shadow: 0px 0px 10px 4px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
    padding: 20px;
    border-radius: 10px;
}

/ Style character list container /
.form-line {
    margin-bottom: 15px;
}

/ Customize placeholder text /
input::placeholder {
    color: #000;  / Change placeholder text to black /
    font-style: italic;
}

/ Customize text area fields /
textarea {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);  / Lighten background for readability /
    color: black;  / Change text color to black /
    border: 1px solid #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Make text fields dark and mysterious /
input {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);  / Lighten background for readability /
    color: black;  / Change text color to black /
    border: 1px solid #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Make headings stand out /
.form-section {
    margin-bottom: 30px;
    color: black; / Ensure headings are black /
    font-weight: bold;
}

/ Add a mystical glow around the form /
.form-all {
    box-shadow: 0 0 15px 5px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
}

/ Make radio buttons larger /
input[type="radio"], input[type="checkbox"] {
    width: 18px;
    height: 18px;
}

/ Center the form on the page /
.supernova {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: center;
    align-items: center;
    min-height: 100vh;
}

What’s Changed:

    - Font Color: Changed all text color to black for better visibility.
  • Bold Text: Applied bold font to all elements for better readability.
  • Text Shadow: Removed the text shadow from the form title to make it clearer.
  • Form Labels and Options: Ensured the form labels and selection options are bold and visible.

How to Apply the CSS:

    1. Log into Jotform and open your form.
  1. Click on Form Designer (the paint roller icon).
  2. Scroll down to the CSS section and paste this updated CSS.
  3. Save and preview your form to ensure everything looks as expected with the black and bold text.
Feel free to let me know if you need any further adjustments!
User
Can you provide a description for the product page of the investigator role
Assistant
Certainly! Here's a compelling product page description for the Investigator Role in your murder mystery game, emphasizing the intrigue and engagement this role offers:

Become the Investigator: Uncover the Truth Behind the Mystery

Step into the shoes of the Investigator, the key player in unraveling the twisted secrets of The Hexed Circle. As the Investigator, it’s your job to untangle the web of lies, dark magic, and hidden motives lurking in the coven. Armed with your keen intellect and unmatched intuition, you will lead the charge in solving the High Witch’s murder and bringing justice to the sacred circle.

Role Overview:

As the Investigator, your role is crucial to the progression of the game. You’ll gather clues, interrogate suspects, and work tirelessly to uncover the identity of the murderer. Your sharp eye for detail and ability to read between the lines will be vital as you navigate the dangerous dynamics of the coven.

Key Responsibilities:

    - Lead the Investigation: Use logic and deduction to follow the trail of clues scattered throughout the game.
  • Interrogate Suspects: Conduct interviews with the other players, probing for hidden motives and uncovering contradictions in their stories.
  • Solve the Mystery: Piece together the clues, testimonies, and evidence to unveil the murderer and their methods.

What You’ll Love About This Role:

    - Master of Clues: Enjoy the thrill of being the first to uncover key pieces of evidence that will point to the killer.
  • Engage in Deep Strategy: This role is perfect for players who enjoy solving puzzles and outsmarting their opponents.
  • Immerse Yourself in the Story: With your guidance, the plot thickens and the tension heightens as the coven races against time to catch the murderer.

Perfect For:

    - Detective Enthusiasts: If you love detective novels, crime-solving games, or true crime podcasts, this role will give you the thrill of being at the center of the action.
  • Problem Solvers: Use your critical thinking skills to analyze clues and evidence and guide the group toward solving the murder.
  • Leaders and Negotiators: Take charge of the investigation, ask the tough questions, and lead the group toward justice.

Are You Ready to Solve the Mystery?

The Investigator role puts you in the driver’s seat of this dark, magical murder mystery. Every question you ask, every clue you find, brings you closer to exposing the truth. Do you have what it takes to uncover the secrets hidden within The Hexed Circle?
This description should entice players who love problem-solving, leading investigations, and immersing themselves in intricate, story-driven experiences. It positions the Investigator as an exciting and critical role for those who want to be central to solving the mystery. Let me know if you'd like any adjustments or further details!
User
Can you give me the code again but with the font larger
Assistant
Certainly! Here’s the updated CSS with larger font sizes to ensure all text is easily readable in your form:

Updated Jotform CSS with Larger Font Sizes

css
/ Background: Mystical theme with the new background /
.form-all {
    background: url('https://images.pexels.com/photos/3488402/pexels-photo-3488402.jpeg') no-repeat center center;
    background-size: cover;
    background-attachment: fixed;
    color: black;  / Ensure text color is black /
    font-family: 'Garamond', serif;
    font-weight: bold;  / Make all text bold /
}

/ Form title customization /
.form-header-group {
    text-align: center;
    color: black; / Change title text color to black /
    font-size: 34px; / Increase title font size /
    text-shadow: none; / Remove text shadow for clarity /
    font-weight: bold;
}

/ Customize the field label (character selection prompt) /
.form-label {
    font-size: 22px; / Increase label font size /
    font-weight: bold;
    color: black; / Change label text color to black /
}

/ Customize the radio/checkbox options /
.form-radio-item label, .form-checkbox-item label {
    font-size: 20px; / Increase option text size /
    padding: 5px;
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);  / Lighten background of options /
    border-radius: 5px;
    color: black;  / Change option text color to black /
    font-weight: bold;
}

/ Hover effect on options /
.form-radio-item:hover, .form-checkbox-item:hover {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);  / Darken hover effect /
    color: black;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Customize form button (Submit) /
.form-submit-button {
    background-color: #6b2a2a; / Deep red /
    color: white;
    font-size: 22px; / Increase button text size /
    padding: 12px 24px;
    border-radius: 8px;
    border: 2px solid #3e1515; / Dark red border /
    cursor: pointer;
}

.form-submit-button:hover {
    background-color: #902b2b;
    border-color: #6b2a2a;
}

/ Style the overall form /
.form-all {
    border: 2px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.5);
    box-shadow: 0px 0px 10px 4px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
    padding: 20px;
    border-radius: 10px;
}

/ Style character list container /
.form-line {
    margin-bottom: 15px;
}

/ Customize placeholder text /
input::placeholder {
    color: #000;  / Change placeholder text to black /
    font-style: italic;
    font-size: 18px;  / Increase placeholder text size /
}

/ Customize text area fields /
textarea {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);  / Lighten background for readability /
    color: black;  / Change text color to black /
    border: 1px solid #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
    font-size: 18px;  / Increase text area font size /
}

/ Make text fields dark and mysterious /
input {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);  / Lighten background for readability /
    color: black;  / Change text color to black /
    border: 1px solid #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
    font-size: 18px;  / Increase input field text size /
}

/ Make headings stand out /
.form-section {
    margin-bottom: 30px;
    color: black; / Ensure headings are black /
    font-weight: bold;
    font-size: 24px; / Increase heading font size /
}

/ Add a mystical glow around the form /
.form-all {
    box-shadow: 0 0 15px 5px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
}

/ Make radio buttons larger /
input[type="radio"], input[type="checkbox"] {
    width: 20px;  / Increase radio button size /
    height: 20px;  / Increase checkbox size /
}

/ Center the form on the page /
.supernova {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: center;
    align-items: center;
    min-height: 100vh;
}

What’s Changed:

    - Larger Font Sizes:
  • Form title: 34px
  • Field labels: 22px
  • Radio/checkbox options: 20px
  • Submit button text: 22px
  • Placeholder text and input field text: 18px
  • Section headings: 24px
  • Increased Radio/Checkbox Size:
  • The radio buttons and checkboxes are now larger at 20px.

How to Apply the CSS:

    1. Log into Jotform and open your form.
  1. Click on Form Designer (the paint roller icon).
  2. Scroll down to the CSS section and paste the code.
  3. Save and preview your form to see the larger fonts and adjustments.
Let me know if you need any additional tweaks!
User
The product descriptions are still small
Assistant
Thanks for the clarification! Let's increase the font size specifically for product descriptions, such as the character selection descriptions or other text fields. Here’s the updated CSS that specifically targets product description text to ensure it’s larger and easier to read:

Updated Jotform CSS with Larger Font for Product Descriptions

css
/ Background: Mystical theme with the new background /
.form-all {
    background: url('https://images.pexels.com/photos/3488402/pexels-photo-3488402.jpeg') no-repeat center center;
    background-size: cover;
    background-attachment: fixed;
    color: black;  / Ensure text color is black /
    font-family: 'Garamond', serif;
    font-weight: bold;  / Make all text bold /
}

/ Form title customization /
.form-header-group {
    text-align: center;
    color: black; / Change title text color to black /
    font-size: 34px; / Increase title font size /
    text-shadow: none; / Remove text shadow for clarity /
    font-weight: bold;
}

/ Customize the field label (character selection prompt) /
.form-label {
    font-size: 22px; / Increase label font size /
    font-weight: bold;
    color: black; / Change label text color to black /
}

/ Customize product description (character descriptions) /
.form-product-item .form-sub-label {
    font-size: 20px; / Increase font size for product descriptions /
    color: black;
    font-weight: bold;
}

/ Customize the radio/checkbox options /
.form-radio-item label, .form-checkbox-item label {
    font-size: 20px; / Increase option text size /
    padding: 5px;
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);  / Lighten background of options /
    border-radius: 5px;
    color: black;  / Change option text color to black /
    font-weight: bold;
}

/ Hover effect on options /
.form-radio-item:hover, .form-checkbox-item:hover {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);  / Darken hover effect /
    color: black;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

/ Customize form button (Submit) /
.form-submit-button {
    background-color: #6b2a2a; / Deep red /
    color: white;
    font-size: 22px; / Increase button text size /
    padding: 12px 24px;
    border-radius: 8px;
    border: 2px solid #3e1515; / Dark red border /
    cursor: pointer;
}

.form-submit-button:hover {
    background-color: #902b2b;
    border-color: #6b2a2a;
}

/ Style the overall form /
.form-all {
    border: 2px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.5);
    box-shadow: 0px 0px 10px 4px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
    padding: 20px;
    border-radius: 10px;
}

/ Style character list container /
.form-line {
    margin-bottom: 15px;
}

/ Customize placeholder text /
input::placeholder {
    color: #000;  / Change placeholder text to black /
    font-style: italic;
    font-size: 18px;  / Increase placeholder text size /
}

/ Customize text area fields /
textarea {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);  / Lighten background for readability /
    color: black;  / Change text color to black /
    border: 1px solid #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
    font-size: 18px;  / Increase text area font size /
}

/ Make text fields dark and mysterious /
input {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);  / Lighten background for readability /
    color: black;  / Change text color to black /
    border: 1px solid #fff;
    border-radius: 5px;
    font-size: 18px;  / Increase input field text size /
}

/ Make headings stand out /
.form-section {
    margin-bottom: 30px;
    color: black; / Ensure headings are black /
    font-weight: bold;
    font-size: 24px; / Increase heading font size /
}

/ Add a mystical glow around the form /
.form-all {
    box-shadow: 0 0 15px 5px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
}

/ Make radio buttons larger /
input[type="radio"], input[type="checkbox"] {
    width: 20px;  / Increase radio button size /
    height: 20px;  / Increase checkbox size /
}

/ Center the form on the page /
.supernova {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: center;
    align-items: center;
    min-height: 100vh;
}

Key Changes:

    - Product Descriptions (Character Descriptions):
  • Increased the font size of product descriptions (character details) to 20px and made them bold for better readability.
  • The product descriptions are targeted using .form-product-item .form-sub-label.

How to Apply the CSS:

    1. Log into Jotform and open your form.
  1. Click on Form Designer (paint roller icon).
  2. Scroll to the CSS section and paste this updated CSS.
  3. Save your form and preview it to check the larger text for product/character descriptions.
Feel free to try this out, and let me know if you need further adjustments!
User
Provide everything i need to create a facebook event, and any other place you think we should post it to get the most traction
Assistant

Creating a Facebook Event for Your Murder Mystery: The Hexed Circle

To create a successful and attention-grabbing Facebook event for The Hexed Circle: Coven Murder Mystery, follow these steps, along with suggestions on promoting the event on other platforms.

Step-by-Step Guide to Creating the Facebook Event:

  1. Go to the "Events" Tab:
    - On your Facebook homepage, click on "Events" in the left-hand menu.
  • Click on "Create New Event" in the top right corner.
  1. Choose Event Type:
    - Select In-Person (if the event will be held at a physical venue) or Online (if virtual or hybrid).
  • If it’s a restaurant-based dinner event, select In-Person.
  1. Add Event Details:

Event Name:

    - Event Name: The Hexed Circle: Coven Murder Mystery Dinner
  • Keep it short, intriguing, and to the point. This title emphasizes the magical theme and makes it clear it's a murder mystery dinner event.

Location:

    - Add the restaurant’s name and address where the event will take place.

Date and Time:

    - Pick a date and time for the event, allowing people to plan ahead. Consider an evening or weekend time for optimal attendance.

Description:

Here’s a copy-paste event description you can use:
🧙‍♀️🔮 Welcome to The Hexed Circle: Coven Murder Mystery Dinner! 🔮🧙‍♂️ ✨ Join us for an immersive, magical evening filled with intrigue, mystery, and dark magic! ✨ In this one-of-a-kind event, you'll become a member of The Hexed Circle, a powerful coven, gathered to perform a sacred ritual. But when the High Witch is mysteriously murdered, the coven is thrown into chaos. Now, it's up to YOU to solve the murder and uncover the dark secrets hidden within the circle. 🕵️‍♀️🔍 🎭 What to Expect:
    - Dress as a witch, warlock, or magical being from your wildest dreams 🧙‍♀️
  • Enjoy a decadent three-course dinner while unraveling the mystery 🍽️
  • Play as a unique character with specific goals, relationships, and secrets 🤫
  • Interrogate your fellow coven members and gather clues to solve the murder 🔮
  • Awards for Best Actor/Actress, Keen Detective, Best Costume, and more! 🏆
This is not just a dinner party—it’s an interactive, theatrical experience where you will be fully immersed in the magical world of witches, necromancers, and dark spells. Will you be able to solve the mystery? Or will the murderer walk free? 😈 📅 Date: [Insert date] 🕒 Time: [Insert start and end time] 📍 Location: [Insert restaurant/venue name and address] Tickets are limited, so grab yours now! 🎟️ [Link to ticket sales or RSVP]

Add Event Category:

    - Select "Dinner", "Performance", or "Party" as your category, depending on your target audience.

Upload a Cover Photo:

    - Use an image that reflects the mood of the event (witches, covens, mystery). You can use a stock photo, a graphic you design, or something related to the theme. Ensure it's visually engaging and high resolution (1200 x 628 px is ideal for Facebook event banners).
  • If you need a suggestion, this image from Pexels or this mysterious forest image would work well.

Add Co-Hosts:

    - If the restaurant or other partners are involved, add them as co-hosts to help spread the word.

Ticketing Information:

    - If you are selling tickets, add the link to the ticketing page (Eventbrite, Ticketmaster, or your website). Alternatively, you can have people RSVP on Facebook if you're managing the guest list directly.
  1. Publish and Promote:
  • Invite Friends: Once the event is published, invite as many people from your friends list as possible, especially those who enjoy immersive experiences or themed events.
  • Share in Groups: Share your event in relevant local Facebook groups, especially those focused on entertainment, themed dinners, or social gatherings.
  • Boost Event: If you want to extend your reach, you can use Facebook’s event boosting feature, which allows you to promote the event with targeted ads (based on location, interests, etc.).

Additional Platforms to Promote Your Event:

1. Instagram:

    - Create Instagram Stories and Posts: Use visually striking imagery and video teasers to promote the event. Countdown stickers or polls can help increase engagement.
  • Instagram Ads: You can run ads targeting people interested in witchcraft, murder mysteries, or themed parties.
  • Hashtags: Use relevant hashtags such as #MurderMysteryDinner, #WitchyEvents, #CovenMystery, and #InteractiveTheater to increase visibility.

2. Eventbrite:

    - Post your event on Eventbrite, a popular ticketing platform for in-person and virtual events. Eventbrite helps with SEO, so your event will also show up on Google search results.
  • Use this as a primary ticketing platform or an alternative RSVP method. Eventbrite allows for better tracking and management of ticket sales.

3. Meetup:

    - Post your event on Meetup.com. This platform is great for local groups looking for unique social activities.
  • Target groups that are into murder mysteries, board games, or themed parties, as they will likely be interested in your event.

4. Local Event Websites or Magazines:

    - Look for local event directories or online publications where you can list your event, such as Eventful, Yelp, or Time Out.
  • Reach out to local magazines or entertainment blogs, especially those that feature restaurant events or live experiences.

5. Reddit:

    - Post your event on local subreddits like r/[YourCity], r/socialclubs, or themed subreddits like r/mystery or r/theater.
  • Engage in the comments and build excitement with more detailed descriptions about the characters or storyline.

6. Email Marketing:

    - If you have an email list (or the restaurant does), send out an eye-catching email promoting the event. Include visuals, character highlights, and a ticket link.
  • If you’re using an email service like Mailchimp or Constant Contact, create a dedicated email campaign around the event.

7. Google My Business:

    - If the restaurant or venue has a Google My Business page, make sure the event is listed there to increase visibility to local people searching for things to do.

Sample Social Media Post for Promotion:

Facebook & Instagram Post:
    - "🧙‍♀️ Ready to uncover a dark mystery? 🔮 Join us for The Hexed Circle: Coven Murder Mystery Dinner on [Date] at [Venue]! Step into a world of witches, warlocks, and dark magic as you enjoy a decadent 3-course meal 🍽️ and work to solve the mysterious murder of the High Witch! 🕵️‍♀️ Will YOU catch the killer? 🎭 🎟️ Tickets are limited—get yours now! [Link]"
Instagram Story:
    - Use a Countdown Sticker leading up to the event day, with engaging visuals of witches, the venue, or teaser character cards.

Extra Tips for Gaining Traction:

    - Early Bird Discounts: Offer discounted early bird tickets to encourage early sign-ups.
  • Engage Influencers: If there are local influencers or bloggers who enjoy interactive events, invite them in exchange for a review or promotion on their channels.
  • Behind-the-Scenes Content: Show sneak peeks of costumes, venue setup, or interviews with the "cast" of the mystery to build hype.
If you’d like more specific help with any of these steps, let me know! This strategy should set you up for a well-promoted and highly engaging event!

Assistant
Absolutely! Here's an event description that builds intrigue around the The Hexed Circle murder mystery without revealing the victim:
🧙‍♀️🔮 Enter The Hexed Circle: A Coven Murder Mystery Dinner Experience! 🔮🧙‍♂️ ✨ Step into a world of witches, warlocks, and dark magic for an unforgettable night of mystery, magic, and murder! ✨ You’ve been invited to a secret gathering of The Hexed Circle, a powerful coven meeting under the light of the full moon to perform a sacred ritual. But as the night unfolds, something sinister happens... A member of the coven is found dead, and it’s up to YOU to solve the mystery! 🕵️‍♀️🔍 🎭 What to Expect:
    - Dress in your most enchanting witch or warlock attire to join the coven 🧙‍♀️
  • Enjoy a three-course dinner while unraveling the mystery 🍽️
  • Play as a unique character with personal goals, secrets, and alliances 🤫
  • Search for clues, interrogate fellow coven members, and uncover hidden motives 🔮
  • Awards for Best Detective, Best Actor/Actress, Best Costume, and more! 🏆
This immersive, theatrical experience will fully transport you into a magical world filled with intrigue and danger. Can you untangle the web of lies and dark magic to identify the murderer? Or will the killer walk free under the cover of darkness? 😈 📅 Date: [Insert date] 🕒 Time: [Insert start and end time] 📍 Location: [Insert restaurant/venue name and address] 🎟️ Tickets: Limited availability—secure your spot now! [Link to ticket sales or RSVP]
This description gives potential attendees a sense of mystery and excitement while keeping the identity of the victim secret. It focuses on building anticipation for the immersive experience, the character interactions, and the challenge of solving the crime.

How to Use It:

    - Facebook Event Description: Copy and paste this directly into your Facebook event.
  • Instagram Bio or Eventbrite: Shorten the post slightly or use it in combination with some visuals (like a countdown or sneak peek) to tease the event.
Let me know if you need further adjustments!
User
Can you use selective Unicode formatting so that when I copy and paste the information what you have bolded will be bold and what is not bolded will not be
Assistant
Unfortunately, Unicode itself doesn't support bold formatting in a way that is directly copy-pasteable into most platforms like Facebook or Eventbrite, which don't recognize Markdown or rich text for bolding (they rely on their own formatting options). However, we can use Unicode Bold characters that mimic bold text. Here’s your event description with bold Unicode characters that will carry over when you copy and paste:
🧙‍♀️🔮 𝐄𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐇𝐞𝐱𝐞𝐝 𝐂𝐢𝐫𝐜𝐥𝐞: 𝐀 𝐂𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐧 𝐌𝐮𝐫𝐝𝐞𝐫 𝐌𝐲𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐲 𝐃𝐢𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐫 𝐄𝐱𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞! 🔮🧙‍♂️ ✨ 𝐒𝐭𝐞𝐩 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐨 𝐚 𝐰𝐨𝐫𝐥𝐝 𝐨𝐟 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐬, 𝐰𝐚𝐫𝐥𝐨𝐜𝐤𝐬, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐝𝐚𝐫𝐤 𝐦𝐚𝐠𝐢𝐜 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐚𝐧 𝐮𝐧𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐠𝐞𝐭𝐭𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞 𝐧𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐭 𝐨𝐟 𝐦𝐲𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐲, 𝐦𝐚𝐠𝐢𝐜, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐦𝐮𝐫𝐝𝐞𝐫! ✨ You’ve been invited to a secret gathering of The Hexed Circle, a powerful coven meeting under the light of the full moon to perform a sacred ritual. But as the night unfolds, something sinister happens... A member of the coven is found dead, and it’s up to 𝐘𝐎𝐔 to solve the mystery! 🕵️‍♀️🔍 🎭 𝐖𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐭𝐨 𝐄𝐱𝐩𝐞𝐜𝐭:
    - Dress in your most enchanting witch or warlock attire to join the coven 🧙‍♀️
  • Enjoy a 𝐭𝐡𝐫𝐞𝐞-𝐜𝐨𝐮𝐫𝐬𝐞 𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐫 while unraveling the mystery 🍽️
  • Play as a 𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐜𝐡𝐚𝐫𝐚𝐜𝐭𝐞𝐫 with personal goals, secrets, and alliances 🤫
  • Search for clues, interrogate fellow coven members, and uncover hidden motives 🔮
  • Awards for 𝐁𝐞𝐬𝐭 𝐃𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐯𝐞, 𝐁𝐞𝐬𝐭 𝐀𝐜𝐭𝐨𝐫/𝐀𝐜𝐭𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐬, 𝐁𝐞𝐬𝐭 𝐂𝐨𝐬𝐭𝐮𝐦𝐞, and more! 🏆
This immersive, theatrical experience will fully transport you into a magical world filled with intrigue and danger. Can you untangle the web of lies and dark magic to identify the murderer? Or will the killer walk free under the cover of darkness? 😈 📅 𝐃𝐚𝐭𝐞: [Insert date] 🕒 𝐓𝐢𝐦𝐞: [Insert start and end time] 📍 𝐋𝐨𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧: [Insert restaurant/venue name and address] 🎟️ 𝐓𝐢𝐜𝐤𝐞𝐭𝐬: Limited availability—secure your spot now! [Link to ticket sales or RSVP]

How to Use It:

    1. Copy and paste this description into your Facebook event or any other platform.
  1. The text that is bolded using Unicode characters will remain bold, and the regular text will stay plain.
Let me know if you need further adjustments or have other requests!

Assistant
Great! Here's your updated event description with the specific dates, times, and ticket price included. This version includes all the details for both event days and seatings.
🧙‍♀️🔮 𝐄𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐇𝐞𝐱𝐞𝐝 𝐂𝐢𝐫𝐜𝐥𝐞: 𝐀 𝐂𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐧 𝐌𝐮𝐫𝐝𝐞𝐫 𝐌𝐲𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐲 𝐃𝐢𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐫 𝐄𝐱𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞! 🔮🧙‍♂️ ✨ 𝐒𝐭𝐞𝐩 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐨 𝐚 𝐰𝐨𝐫𝐥𝐝 𝐨𝐟 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐬, 𝐰𝐚𝐫𝐥𝐨𝐜𝐤𝐬, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐝𝐚𝐫𝐤 𝐦𝐚𝐠𝐢𝐜 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐚𝐧 𝐮𝐧𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐠𝐞𝐭𝐭𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞 𝐧𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐭 𝐨𝐟 𝐦𝐲𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐲, 𝐦𝐚𝐠𝐢𝐜, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐦𝐮𝐫𝐝𝐞𝐫! ✨ You’ve been invited to a secret gathering of The Hexed Circle, a powerful coven meeting under the light of the full moon to perform a sacred ritual. But as the night unfolds, something sinister happens... A member of the coven is found dead, and it’s up to 𝐘𝐎𝐔 to solve the mystery! 🕵️‍♀️🔍 🎭 𝐖𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐭𝐨 𝐄𝐱𝐩𝐞𝐜𝐭:
    - Dress in your most enchanting witch or warlock attire to join the coven 🧙‍♀️
  • Enjoy a 𝐭𝐡𝐫𝐞𝐞-𝐜𝐨𝐮𝐫𝐬𝐞 𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐫 while unraveling the mystery 🍽️
  • Play as a 𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐜𝐡𝐚𝐫𝐚𝐜𝐭𝐞𝐫 with personal goals, secrets, and alliances 🤫
  • Search for clues, interrogate fellow coven members, and uncover hidden motives 🔮
  • Awards for 𝐁𝐞𝐬𝐭 𝐃𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐯𝐞, 𝐁𝐞𝐬𝐭 𝐀𝐜𝐭𝐨𝐫/𝐀𝐜𝐭𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐬, 𝐁𝐞𝐬𝐭 𝐂𝐨𝐬𝐭𝐮𝐦𝐞, and more! 🏆
This immersive, theatrical experience will fully transport you into a magical world filled with intrigue and danger. Can you untangle the web of lies and dark magic to identify the murderer? Or will the killer walk free under the cover of darkness? 😈 📅 𝐃𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐬 & 𝐓𝐢𝐦𝐞𝐬: 𝐎𝐜𝐭𝐨𝐛𝐞𝐫 𝟏𝟖𝐭𝐡 – Seating at 𝟕:𝟎𝟎 𝐩𝐦 𝐎𝐜𝐭𝐨𝐛𝐞𝐫 𝟏𝟗𝐭𝐡 – Two seatings at 𝟓:𝟑𝟎 𝐩𝐦 and 𝟖:𝟑𝟎 𝐩𝐦 📍 𝐋𝐨𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧: [Insert restaurant/venue name and address] 🎟️ 𝐓𝐢𝐜𝐤𝐞𝐭 𝐏𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐞: $𝟔𝟓 𝐩𝐞𝐫 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐨𝐧 – Limited availability, so reserve your spot now! Once they select the character they want to be, they will get an email containing everything they need for part 1 of the mystery event.

Here’s your updated event description with all the additional information included about the hors d’oeuvres, drinks, and character selection process. This will ensure everything is clear for potential attendees:
🧙‍♀️🔮 𝐄𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐇𝐞𝐱𝐞𝐝 𝐂𝐢𝐫𝐜𝐥𝐞: 𝐀 𝐂𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐧 𝐌𝐮𝐫𝐝𝐞𝐫 𝐌𝐲𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐲 𝐃𝐢𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐫 𝐄𝐱𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞! 🔮🧙‍♂️ ✨ 𝐒𝐭𝐞𝐩 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐨 𝐚 𝐰𝐨𝐫𝐥𝐝 𝐨𝐟 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐬, 𝐰𝐚𝐫𝐥𝐨𝐜𝐤𝐬, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐝𝐚𝐫𝐤 𝐦𝐚𝐠𝐢𝐜 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐚𝐧 𝐮𝐧𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐠𝐞𝐭𝐭𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞 𝐧𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐭 𝐨𝐟 𝐦𝐲𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐲, 𝐦𝐚𝐠𝐢𝐜, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐦𝐮𝐫𝐝𝐞𝐫! ✨ You’ve been invited to a secret gathering of The Hexed Circle, a powerful coven meeting under the light of the full moon to perform a sacred ritual.
